result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig S. Micke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case No. 2013CF000174

miscConds.notes: Court Costs paid in full from cash bond previously posted.  The remaining portion of the cash bond in the amount of $307.00 has been applied to companion case of 2013CF000174.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Court orders forfeiture and destruction of the Davis Industries Model P-380 automatic pistol seized.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

from DOC Admissions Registrar Dated 3/20/2015 Re: Amendment to JOC as to Probation Term - Court authorizes Amendment to 1 yr probation term.
As to Count No. 3
As to Count Nos 1 and 2

13CF-174, 14CF-146 and 14CM-24 - All Cases Called @ 2:50 PM: Defendant Craig S Micke in court with attorney Ryan Scott Ulrich.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by DA.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.  Court entertains waiver of pre-lim hearing as to 13CF-174.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.   Def BOT.  INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per Atty Ulrich NC plea to be entered.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Meds serving no impairment on proceeding today.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  13CF-174 Plea:  NC  13TR-2474 Plea (RCS):  NC  14CF-146 Plea Ct 3:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.   Ct 1 and 2 of 14CF-146 DRI.  14CM-24 DRI.   Argument by DA as to cond'l WCJ imposition.  Argument by Atty Ulrich - argues against imposition of cond'l time - may put benefits in jeopardy.  Statement by Def:  Concerned over PT appts - 3-4 times per week - recent surgery.  Apologizes to the Court.  The Court:  Views matters from an impaired driving standpoint rather than possession case. 13TR-2474 (RCS):  $761.50 forfeiture and 7 mos DL Rev.  13CF-174  and 14CF-146:  S/W - 2 yrs probation. Conditions:   13CF-174 Only - 25 days WCJ cond'l time.  Conditions Applied to Both:  AODA; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Court costs of each Case - DNA as to BJump only - No DNA as to 13CF-174.  Appeal Rights Given.  Davis 380 ordered forfeited and destroyed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 11, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on February 4, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on January 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ryan S. Ulrich in court.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by Attorney Ulrich requests additional status.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on December 9, 2014 at 09:10 am.

13CF174, 13TR2474, 14CM24 & 14CF146. Cases called at 1:14 pm. Defendant Craig S. Micke in court with attorney Ryan S. Ulrich.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing and time limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   Bond to continue. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 09:10 am.

No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:14 p.m. Defendant Craig S. Micke in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Cash Bond. Atty Szilagyi requesting lower cash bond or signature bond. Court orders $800 Cash Bond. IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 09:45 am.
